Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the Weichmann, what can I say? Excellent location, good breakfast, frendly helpful staff and Taz to greet us. Our stay was an absolute delight and we will stay again on our next visit to Amsterdam. Be sure to visit Pompadou for the best apple Dutch cake ( as recommended by a local ) - the hotel will give you directions and it's very close. Our room overlooked the canal which was fantastic, very quite and peaceful - well done The Weichmann, we will certainly recommend you to family and friends. Robert & Sue - Leeds

Reviews.Title: “4 Days in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and welcoming hotel. Great location, especially as Amsterdam is a lot smaller than it seems, we walked everywhere from here with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Spring trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Richard D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned hotel in a very convennient location within walking distance of the city centre and art galleries. Very, very quiet in our bedroom with an immaculate ensuite bathroom. Furniture old but beds very comfortable. Service at reception friendly and efficient - we asked to borrow a hair dryer and it appeared within a minute. Adequate continental buffet style breakfast in a sunny room overlooking the canal with an excellent view of Amsterdam's cycling culture in action.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in the center of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: liesbeth k Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice and cosy hotel right in the center of the city. Beautiful view from room on the canal. Breakfast not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, Needs Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: zakcoop
Reviews.Content: Wi-Fi access is spotty, the family suite was very noisy as it faces the main thoroughfare with many drunks and late night bicyclists and scooters and the floors were extremely creaky in our room. The windows are old, and probably necessarily so since they curve and add to the external charm. If you can get past these negatives, Hotel Weichman has several things going for it. It is in a perfect location, near several parking garages (if you deem a car necessary), has well appointed rooms, offers a nice breakfast buffet, and the staff is very friendly (including the hotel's dog, Taz). The noise would have us looking elsewhere if we were to stay in Amsterdam again, but I would look for another hotel in the old part of the city as it was beautiful and packed full of museums, restaurants and other important elements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in the family suite. Very large, clean room. The reception was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location to the Anne Frank house and other sites. We rented a van rather then use public transportation because of the places we wanted to visit - Kinderdijk, Delft Pottery and Keukenhof. There is NO parking and dropping off luggage can be a challenge as the streets are narrow, not allowing other cars to pass. There is a nice secure lot - Europark Q park- just a few blocks away and about 40 EU a day. The hotel does have a resident German Shepard named Taz. She is very friendly and calm, but if you have an allergy to dogs (as I do), it makes for a congested stay. The hair from the dog is cleaned up, but still effected our allergies. Noise from the street and the grandfather clock can be heard easily at night. Breakfast was simple with cereals, breads, meats, cheese, egg and juice/tea/ coffee, but it was filling for our family. Staircases are steep, but the reception did offer to help with luggage if we needed it. No lift and all the rooms are up at least 1 staircase. So if you have difficulty with steps, this not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Big room by European standards”
Reviews.Author: hochbeam
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room here while staying four nights in Amsterdam. The hotel is conveniently located between two major tram lines, each about 7 minutes away. However it is not immediately next to a tram stop, and has typical Dutch steep staircases, so if you have trouble walking, this is not the place for you. The location on Prinsengracht is nice and we had a great view of the canal. Breakfast is fine but basic. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Homely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aldeburghmuso
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Wiechmann for two nights and had a pleasant time. The room was nice and clean, even though a bit small and the breakfast was very good. The reception was friendly and I felt at home immediately. The hotel is well-situated on the quiet Prinsegracht. I would definitely return here when I am back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a city break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Walters_10
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time reviewing hotels before we made a choice. Many of the cheaper hotels seemed to be hostel types and we wanted something better but still at a reasonable price. We are a family of four with two children aged 17 and 15 and wanted somewhere suitable to explore the city. This hotel was ideal. It was clean and welcoming. We had a room with four single beds and an en suite shower and toilet. The breakfast was continental, but there was plenty. Others have mentioned the traditional narrow steep stairways, so beware. The location is good, just along from Anne Frank's house, but away from the noisier parts of the centre - you must expect to walk or catch trams to get to the sites wherever you choose in Amsterdam. Whilst there we had a good meal at a good price at Rancho, a steak and ribs restaurant further out from Dam Square (10 - 15 euros and 4.50 euros for a pint of local lager).

Reviews.Title: “good site in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Rahel L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: in my opinion, the hotel is on a good site of the city. the view of the canal is very nice. Unfortunately I didn't like the breakfast very much. the selection was not very large.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: H G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed in Amsterdam and this was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in here. Without a doubt, I will stay here again. Room was clean and water pressure in the bathroom was fantastic. We had a room at the top in the back and it was very quiet - perfect for a good nights sleep. Management was brilliant. Very polite. Breakfasts were tremendous - all you could eat - cereals, toast, eggs, meats, cheese. Delicious. And to top it all, the highlight was Taz the dog who could often be found snoring in reception. He was gorgeous. Highly recommended. A*

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stars say it all. The staff were helpful personified. The room size generous and very well furnished. The location perfect for the old town. The breakfast room has one of the best views of the town and the quality of the breakfast was high. There was some noise from the street from our room on the 2nd floor at the front but to have the view over the bridge and the canal you have to be in that position and the view more than makes up for it. I was very satisified and next time I come to Amsterdam will book without a second thought;.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best location in Amsterdam and a hotel dog!”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is perfect for walking to just about any attraction. Yes the rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are modern. Yes, their is a flatscreen TV and free, very fast WiFi but the real reason for staying here is Taz! Taz is the sweetest, most gentle German Shepherd I've ever met. She greets everyone with a wagging tail and if you give her any attention at all (and how could you not?) she rolls right over to have a tummy tickle. But seriously, this is a very well run hotel with owners who truly care about the comfort of their guests. Everyone on the desk was helpful and always had a smile on their face. The only criticism I could offer is that you can hear everything going by on the street if you are in the front of the hotel. But if you want a canal view room (and believe me...you want a canal view room) just bring along ear plugs and all is good. It's not like there are parties going on outside. It is a quiet area. But you can hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Ivelina M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and a great value for money! It is in convenient to arrive by tram from Central Station, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but comfortable and have everything you need. The owner is a third generation of the hotel founder and you can tell it is a family business-the decor is very nice and the breakfast room view is on two canals-what a way to start the day! Breakfast is good and traditional. The location is fantastic for sightseeing and shopping. Much nicer and much better value then some others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Room but No lift”
Reviews.Author: nlewin28
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Wiechmann when visiting Amsterdam and it must be said it was great. The room was spacious and comfortable and the staff were really friendly. The Hotel is a short walk from Ann Frank's house and not to far from the hustle and bustle of the local shops. One thing i would advise is that i can imagine in summer the rooms would be very warm as there is no air cond and if you are not good with steep stairs i would ask for a room on a lower floor or not stay here as there is no lift! The rooms are clean and breakfast is also very good.... I would certainly return to this hotel on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Montbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in late February 2012. We always try to stay in the Canal Zone when we go to Amsterdam, but it is getting very expensive to find good quality hotels we can afford. So the Wiechmann was a real find. Location is excellent - on the Prinzengracht. The hotel was very comfortable and clean - bedroom a good size. We loved the antiques in the room and throughout the hotel. We also became firm friends with the resident dog! If you can afford it pay a little more for a canal view room - you really can watch the whole of life go by. In the morning we simply sat and looked out for a while: after supper we returned to the room, turned off all the lights, and opened the curtains. Staff were helpful and friendly. Only slight minuses were that the breakfast was exactly the same each day, and could be more imaginative, and a first floor canal view room can be noisy on a Friday evening (although the other evenings were very quiet). But overall we were very satisfied and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnite Stop”
Reviews.Author: lfrogg
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and modern bathroom. Yes, fairly steep stairs but you have to remember where you are. Only a one block walk to the Ann Frank house. The room was comfortably warm on this cool spring day and the double bed was larger than we expected. We had a great sleep. Coming from Western Canada, continental breakfast in the spacious dining room on the corner of the block where we could watch everyone bicycle to work was awesome! And yes, the 1,2 and 5 tram go by - but three to four blocks away - just do your research and take a map and you'll be OK finding the Wiechmann.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Thought We Were Getting”
Reviews.Author: Steve D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Through no fault of their own, the room was not what we expected. We booked this hotel because of a picture on a booking website instead of the hotel's website. The picture is what we thought the hotel room would look like, instead we got a single room with 4 separate twin beds. Look directly at this hotel's website to see what you are getting!!! Steep stairways amidst hallways that smelled terrible!!! No elevator. When we complained of the mix-up, the manager did not offer an upgrade or adjustment to our bill. Breakfast was in a beautiful room where you could watch the world ride by on their bikes. Food was just so-so. This place is clean, no bed bugs. Heater did not work in my friend's room. The hotel has trouble taking American Credit Cards. They will ask for a 20 euro deposit for your room. Great location!! Canals are right outside and you walk to many places such as the Anne Frank House.

Reviews.Title: “Fab small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilypad_hopper
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in traditional canal side houses (steep steps but someone carried my bags up and back down) I booked a small single but got given a nice big double. The room was immaculately clean, with a big bath and plenty of hot water. This is a traditional family style hotel with friendly staff. Breakfast perfectly adequate, if unexciting, but lots of it. Pretty breakfast room with canal views. There is a public lounge furnished in traditional style with hot drinks available. No kettle in room but lots of cafes and bars nearby. Supermarket just 50 metres up the street. Gorgeous dog in reception to make a fuss of.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: HertfordPeter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four years ago (business) and, when I had to plan a trip for a small group (pleasure), felt confident that the hotel would suit everyone's needs. It's perfectly positioned to walk in a leisurely way to all the main attractions and in the morning, looking out of the breakfast room directly on to a bridge over Prinsengracht is a real pleasure. Rooms are very comfortable and though they are not completely up-to-date with the latest wardrobes, everything is spotlessly clean, the beds are comfy, the digital TV has plenty of channels to keep you in touch with home (if you need to do that) and the water is always hot. The staff are courteous and there's always someone at reception to greet you, as well as the old house dog, who is very sweet if a little immobile. The location is truly excellent. Within a hundred yards are in one of Festina Lente or Het Molenpad, two excellent brown pubs/bars, both with restaurant-quality food. The beer's not bad either! Meanwhile, if you go down any of the roads pointing towards Herengracht then you will stumble into any of a myriad of boutiques, antique shops or small restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Nice Dog, and Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler0313
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location hotel for getting around Amsterdam on foot. Lots of museums and restaurants within easy walking distance (a few blocks to the Anne Frank House and a 20 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum) make this place ideal. Had a great room overlooking the canal and the hotel staff very accommodating. Steps are steep (it's a canal house hotel), so pack light! Also, the rooms can get warm (no air conditioning) and I visited in April 2011 when they were having unseasonably warm weather. Get a room with lots of windows (in the front) to get a nice breeze; otherwise you'll incubate on the upper floor back rooms. And the hotel has an arrangement with a cab driver to get you to the airport so you don't get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyzzaaaffdfd
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something different than the big hotel chains which are all the same - go for the Wiechman - family type, great lobby - lovely canal view rooms, clean, large - perfect location just on the corner of the 9th street block - great value for money The breakfast can be a bit better - add some decent coffee and yogurts and it will be perfect

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janHebdenBridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for visiting anywhere in Amsterdam. We could easily walk to all the sights recorded by other reviewers.The decor and furnishings of our bedroom and the public areas and the steep stairs added to the Dutch experience and were really appreciated. We had a double room with canal view on the third floor and we were very comfortable. The downstairs toilet, lounge, breakfast room and our bed and bathroom were clean and well maintained. There was an ample supply of very hot water even on the top floor. Breakfast was adequate and it was good to watch Amsterdam cycling to work in the mornings. It was pleasant to sit and drink tea with friends and read in the lounge. All in all the three day stay enhanced our enjoyment of Amsterdam. It was great. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the dog was no problem I suppose, if you were not fit, you should request a room on a lower floor!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Bonifastria
Reviews.Content: If you're good at climbing stairs and you love getting greeted by a sleepy doggie at the door, then you will not regret staying here. Wiechmann is tantamount to staying with friends or family in Amsterdam. You won't be disappointed by anything-- the rooms are a bit worn, but just like in a house, that's only because they're well-loved. Visit if you want the relaxed, unpretentious Amsterdam experience. Perfect for families, older couples, and younger couples, too. And don't miss breakfast! It's worth it to eat canalside, watching the Dutch cycling to work as you leisurely munch away.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - you might not have a room...”
Reviews.Author: babyeel
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for three nights. On arrival, we were told that due to an error in processing our booking we didn't have a room for the 2nd of the three nights... not exactly what you want to or expect to hear when you have just arrived at your destination, ready to start your holidays. We were told we would have to speak to the manager who wouldn't be available until 8am the next morning. The whole experience left a bad taste so rather than have the trip ruined we decided to cut our losses and move elsewhere and luckily found somewhere not too far away which was fantastic. Hotel has a huge alsatian in the reception so not for those who don't like dogs. Obviously we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Tisha J
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. Staff was really helpful and friendly. I loved the building. So much character, it was fun exploring. Only reason I gave it 4/5 is because our bed was not so comfortable. It was short and the mattress was not good. Also, it's cool the buffet breakfast was included but was not great. However, the sitting area where you eat is really quaint - it's in the corner part of their hotel. Great view of the streets/canals. We stayed in a room away from the street so it was really nice and quiet. Their dog is AWESOME. He's adorable and super friendly. We were walking distance to everything we wanted to see, including the Anne Frank House and the Van Gogh Museum. High recommend !! Also loved the shower (we got a bathroom with a real shower head!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawniek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a charming, affordable hotel in a great location. The room & bathroom was of decent size. The room was clean & the housekeeping staff did a great job every day. The staff was friendly and helpfu. I love that the family dog lives there and greeted the guests every day. The thing to be aware of is that the steps are steep and depending on where your room is located you may have a lot of steps to climb. The breakfast was good: fresh fruit, toast, eggs, cereal, juice, coffee & tea, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great character in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I was looking for on my recent leisure trip to Amsterdam. I wanted something that was more like a guest house than a hotel, with a lot of uniqueness and charm, in a good location within walking distance of the major tourist sites -- and it didn't disappoint. The Wiechmann is not a 5-star hotel - if that's what you are looking for, you'd better book the Marriott or Crowne Plaza. This is a charming 3-4 star hotel that is the result of 3 historic canal-houses that have been connected together. The stairs are steep and narrow, the wooden floors creak, the decor is eclectic, and I loved it! The hotel is located on the outermost canal ring, the Prinsengracht canal. It's an easy 5 minute walk from the nearest tram stop, which from there you can also easily get to the Centraal train station and the Amsterdam Schipol airport. The "neighborhood" was very lovely and I felt very safe as I walked around. From the hotel, I walked almost everywhere in the central tourist district of Amsterdam, but took the tram sometimes just to save time (or my feet!). The hotel had a nice sitting area in the main reception area, and if you were lucky, the friendly family dog, Taz, would be there to say hello and ask for a belly rub :) There was also a lounge with comfy chairs, a small bar, a TV and a book exchange table. Although I never used it, there was also an internet computer available for guests upon request. The breakfast room was absolutely charming, sitting on the corner of the building, with lovely window views looking out over two canals (one on the front of the building, and the other on the side). It's easy to see that the breakfast room used to be a cafe. It was a pleasure to watch the comings and goings of the Amsterdammers as they went about their daily life while I was eating my breakfast :) The breakfast itself (which was included in the price of the room) was very satisfactory, with an assortment of cereals, fresh fruit, breads, jams, cold meats and cheeses, boiled eggs, juices, milk and coffee/tea. I had a standard-sized single room on the 3rd floor, with a large window overlooking the Prinsengracht canal in front of the hotel. The view was stunning, it was the quintessential view of Amsterdam that I was so eager to see -- and I was even happier to have the view right out my room. My room was not lush, but it was clean, sufficient and functional. I had a large double bed (maybe it was a queen?) which was comfortable and had nice linens with a thick coverlet. The room also had a nice, small flat-screen TV mounted to the wall, a small wall-safe (which wasn't big enough for my laptop or my Kindle, but was perfect for my passport, extra cash, keys, etc.), a heater under the window, and also a freestanding electrical air-conditioner. The bathroom was somewhat small, but it was perfectly fine for one person, and all of the facilities were updated and clean. The room didn't come with a hairdryer, but the front desk was happy to loan me one during my stay. The entire hotel had complimentary wireless internet access, and I had no problems accessing it from my room -- which was a nice bonus. The staff of the hotel were friendly and accommodating. They assisted me with directions and touristic recommendations, they printed some airline boarding passes for me, and they arranged a very early morning taxi back to the airport for me. There was also a slight discrepancy with my rate when I checked-out, and they proactively contacted me before I'd even arrived back home in the States with a resolution. The only thing I can say negative about this hotel is that the walls and ceilings/floors were fairly thin, so I could hear most of what my neighbors were saying and doing in their rooms -- but this is something I would expect in a historical guest house. Also, although I'm very happy that my room overlooked the canal, the downside was having to deal with the noise. Amsterdam doesn't have many cars, but it does have people who are out and about at all hours of the night walking along the canals -- and the sound from their talking and laughter was amplified by the water of the canals and the buildings surrounding them like a canyon. So, because of the "street noise" and the chatter of other hotel guests, I found that the best way to sleep was with ear plugs. Also, although the steep stairs didn't bother me at all, this might be a detractor for someone who is mobility challenged or has a lot of large/heavy luggage to carry. Overall, this hotel was perfect for me. It was precisely the experience I was looking for during my visit to Amsterdam and I would wholeheartedly recommend it to others planning to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: joyt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Wiechmann in a quad room. The location is perfect and was easy to get to using public transportation from the airport. The room was simple. The bathroom was TINY. The stairs were STEEP! Imagine climbing a ladder with your suitcase. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and not looking for any frills.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LibbyGH
Reviews.Content: Located overlooking one of Amsterdam's many canals, the Hotel Wiechmann is in an historical canal building. Our family of four stayed in a 2nd-floor, canal-view "family room", which was absolutely gigantic--so big in fact that when I first walked in, I thought a mistake had been made! High ceilings, creaky hardwood floors, antique wardrobe, huge bathroom. The main room had a king bed and the annex room, with sliding leaded-stained glass divider doors, had two twins for the kids. The tall windows overlooking Prinsengracht street had blackout curtains, which was nice to block out the streetlights. There was some street noise but nothing out of the ordinary; A LOT of people in Amsterdam ride bikes, which of course are quieter than cars. The kids loved the hotel dog, Taz, who was a sweetheart. Breakfast was adequate but there was no cooked food such as eggs or meats--just the basics like toast, fruit, cereal and coffee/tea. The dining room is decorated with Delftware (?) and looks out onto the street, so it was a nice spot to watch the city wake up and commute to school or work by bike. The hotel is a few walkable blocks away from most attractions and as a result has a down-to-earth vibe, very warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Cosy Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: VictorPaname
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of qualities, including the location near the Johnny Jordaan monument, along a canal from the golden age. It's one of the best two-stars hotel in this city. I was a guest in a small single room on the fourth floor, with a beautiful view of the roofs of Amsterdam on the rising sun. This room is modern, well equipped and not so small, if you compare with what other 2* hotels propose. Special mention for the bathroom which is very clean and spacious. A little inconvenient is the absence of a mini fridge. I don't have anything to complain about the staff of this family-run hotel. The included breakfast is copious and tasty, it's taken in a very luminous (eastern orientation), perfect to start the day in a good mood. Safety is also taken seriously, at the entrance and with a personal safe in your room. All of these come at a price, but if you stay more than three nights you can benefit from a 15 %, considerable reduction.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam is pricey...”
Reviews.Author: zoomball
Reviews.Content: So it was expensive for the square footage - but that is Amsterdam. Very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, and have already recommended it”
Reviews.Author: Louise F
Reviews.Content: As other people have said, this hotel is quirky - the stairs have to be seen to be believed, but they were excellent preparation for our trip to the Anne Frank House! It felt as though you were staying in someone's home, rather than a 'McHotel'. This was one of very few hotels I found which offered four-person rooms, which made it a good value stay for us and our teenage children. Our room was right at the top with four twin/single beds and a view over the rooftops. The mattresses seemed new and the linen was very clean. Don't be put off by the â‚¬220 price per room (for four of us per night) - at least this hotel isn't charging extra for breakfast, wifi etc like all the others seem to be, and it is so centrally located that we walked to all of the tourist 'must sees' so saved on transport costs too. The resident dog was very friendly, but was extremely well trained and did not bother us. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel's breakfast room is on the corner of two canals - it used to be a coffee shop and we sat eating our breakfast (which was basic but plentiful - cereals, toast, fruit, cold meats and hard boiled eggs) and watched everyone going to work on their bikes ... we could have lingered for hours, but we had a list of sights to see. You definitely get a flavour of life in the centre of Amsterdam from a stay at this hotel. We would all highly recommend it, and we would go back there very happily.

Reviews.Title: “Super location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: funnyboy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here but my partner has been twice more. We could not fault the hotel and service and we stayed with our other friends,their first visit to the hotel. The stay was over Pride weekend for 3 nights ans we had requested rooms overlooking the canal for the parade on theSaturday ,which we got. These rooms are large and furnished with old style fittings,as compliments the rest of the hotel.Since we were there last year there are new plasma T.V's and new curtains and bedding. This is not a cheap hotel but it is all to do with the location which is in a lovely safe part of Amsterdam with exclusive shopping on the 9 streets which are opposite and also handy for local supermarkets,wine shops and delicious bakeries and ice cream shops.. Breakfast is basic continental but more than enough and buffet is served in abright and cheery ground floor room where you can watch life passing by in all guises.The only thing that would be nice is the addition of yoghurt to the buffet and maybe some nicer pastries and small cakes. As mentioned it is not our first visit and the staff remembered us.The reception staff were all charming and helpful especially Denise.The ladies who do the breakfast and service the rooms went out of their way to be friendly and helpful, with special thanks to Marta for letting us chill our wine and supplying ice for our party on the Saturday. Would not hesitate to recommend the hotel if you like somewhere old fashioned and homely but be warned of the very steep stairs and no lift...you need to be fit. Hope to return next year if not sooner and hope Taz the dog is still around for our daily stroke and a dog chew from home..

Reviews.Title: “great people, rooms not as pictured”
Reviews.Author: connie34043
Reviews.Content: We picked our hotels by the pictures on the websites, and we were pleased with the first two hotels we stayed in (Paris, Delft). However, when we saw the room- it was a "family room"- in the Wiechmann, we were in shock. The hotel pictures showed lovely rooms filled with antiques. Our room was barren, to say the least- no headboards for the four beds which were maybe 16 inches apart, white walls with no pictures, utilitarian closet which wouldn't hold 4 people's things, a tiny round table shoved into a corner with the tv above it so that not all 4 people could even view it, 2 tiny bedside tables. We were on the second floor overlooking inside walls and a floor above the kitchen so we woke each morning to the sound of dishes as they prepared breakfast. We had to pay 20 euros for the key, which we didn't mind except that one key for 4 people is really difficult and there was no extra key option. On the plus side- the various desk people were very friendly, courteous and helpful. It rained during our visit and the downstairs lobby was lovely (as pictured) and big enough for several people so we spent some time there (avoiding the room) and met several very friendly guests. We also like the location- quiet and not very touristy, but close enough to everything. However, if we had seen the room we were receiving beforehand we would have booked elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Still Wonderful after 25 Years!”
Reviews.Author: TonyNYC-NY
Reviews.Content: My last visit to Amsterdam was 25 years ago and I stayed at the Hotel Wiechmann. What a delight to return in June and have my fond memories of this quaint and charming hotel validated. It is central to everything a tourist may want to do and perfectly situated on a canal. Its staff is friendly, professional and very helpful, and my room was well appointed for the price points and very clean. This time I was travelling solo and had an ample size single room with private bath ... and on the first floor. And breakfast was ample and hearty, served in a sunny room with many windows facing the street. My only minor complaint was that the WiFi was not accessible in my room and required me to sit in the lobby area, not such a bad thing, to have full and speedy access. I look forward to staying here again for my next visit to Amsterdam which I know will happen much sooner this time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nole95
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay in this great hotel in Amsterdam. It was myself, wife and two children (7 and 4). We had the family suite. First the room was big and spacious (Room 121). The main room had a large bed for my wife and I. There was then a second large room with two single beds for the kids that was able to be closed off by two sliding doors. A small sitting area then overlooked the canal and street and gave us great views of life passing by outside. There was planty of room for all four of us, which made for a very enjoyable stay. It was very cool during our stay, so we always had the windows shut at night, so noise really was not an issue. The only minor complaint I would have is that very bright lights in the courtyard behind the second bedroom. Even with the very large curtains covering the window, the light was still quite evident. Dimming or turning those lights off after a certain time of night would be the only recommendation I might make. The location could not be beat, and it felt like we were off the tourist track. We were able to walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. Vondelpark, Van Gogh Museum, restaurants, boat tours, etc. Two blocks down around the corner is a grocery store and ATM. About 5-10 minutes from there is the Jordann district with lots of great little places to eat and drink. The Anne Frank museum is also in this area. A quick walk over the canal outside the hotel puts you right in the Nine Little Streets area with its various shops. The hotel staff was great as well. After a long day of travelling the staff was very helpful in pointing us in the right direction for food and an ATM. The kids loved petting the dog in the lobby, which was as friendly as can be, and they even were able to feed it some treats. We had a very early checkout (4:15am), and there was no problem arranging a car to pick us up and getting us to the airport at that hour. We would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again on any future trips we take to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly family hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie2323
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Wiechmann, which is beautifully located on the Prinsengracht canal, very near the Jordaan neighborhood. Our room was at the front, under the gables, overlooking the canal. Small, winding staircases, no elevators, not for guests with large suitcases, but wonderful for folks looking for a stay in a unique, historic hotel. Helpful desk staff. Typical buffet breakfast included in lovely breakfast room. Free WiFi in rooms. All main city museums/attractions in walkable distance, or by tram. Train station also in walkable range. Great neighborhood restaurants. Hotel arranged for taxi to airport - very reasonable cost. We very much enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ptk13
Reviews.Content: The Wiechmann is in an ideal spot for visiting Amsterdam. Right on the edge of the charming Jordaan district, overlooking one of the main canals, and only a few minutes walk from most of the places you'd want to visit. The hotel itself, unfortunately, isn't so great...especially for the amount they charge. The rooms - if mine was anything to go by - are small and pretty basic. And the breakfast can only be described as meagre. But the staff are friendly and helpful, and that location does help make up for its shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: 100db
Reviews.Content: Just as in real estate, a hotel's location is VERY important. This one is perfect--on a canal and near restaurants, but not in the middle of noise and francises. The hotel is basic and, yes, the stairs are steep when you are carrying luggage up three flights, but I am a "senior" and did not find it difficult. We felf very safe walking all over day and night. We were there during Queen's Day and were very happy we were not staying near Dam Square. It is easy to walk everywhere in the city, but nice and quiet when we got "home". We stayed on the back side of the hotel and were not bothered by noise at all. The furnishings are basic, but everything was very clean and the bathroom had been redone fairly recently. Looking our at life while eating breakfast was great. This could not be considered a luxury property, but for the price and location I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming atmospheric hotel in good location but noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: nufcnut
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and we travelled with friends who had been before and had stayed here. The hotel is certainly full of character and well located for all the sights of Amsterdam. Our room was spacious and very clean. Ok, the furniture is a bit old but it was really charming and the great big windows looked out onto the canal and the various comings and goings. It was a really lovely location. No facilities for making a drink but that appears common in a lot of European hotels and we had not expected the facility. We had requested a twin room but had been allocated to a double. That was soon rectified. The stairs are a bit steep, especially when you are dragging a suitcase up two floors!! The breakfast room is light and airy and really has a cafe feel, with shop front type windows looking out onto the canal. The breakfast was basic but ok. Cereals, tinned fruit, meat & cheese, boiled eggs, toast, tea & coffee, all help yourself service. Amsterdam is a very busy and lively city. You expect some degree of noise but seeing as this hotel is not right in the centre, we did not expect sleepless nights. Well, that is what we got!! The noise went on until the wee small hours. Cars, scooters and noisy revellers, it went on for hours. If you are a light sleeper, do not get a canal view room. We did sleep on the last night, probably due to staying up later and having plenty alcohol!

Reviews.Title: “great location ,great views,needs some work”
Reviews.Author: saabsolutely
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on a canal crossroads, ideal for seeing the whole of Amsterdam on foot. Hotels in Amsterdam don't give much for your money and this one is no exception. Breakfast was basic - breakfast room beautiful. Room was spacious but was missing tea and coffee making facilities and no hair dryer . Old furniture was appropriate but missing a handle on the wardrobe and a drawer in the bedside cabinet .(easily fixed). Loved the dog and the narrow canal house stairs. Need to raise their game above the location and the views!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to watch Amsterdam go by”
Reviews.Author: IMT13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room for 2 nights and found the hotel to be quiet but superbly placed for experiencing the Amsterdam we came to see - canals, sights, cafes etc without the more brash side you can enjoy elsewhere. The staff were efficient and helpful from allowing us to check in early to allowing us to leave our bags on the final day so we didn't have to carry them round all day before our ferry left. The breakfast was sufficient without being expansive. A selection of meats, breads and cheeses, cereals, juices, boiled eggs and tea and coffee. The breakfast room though was fantastic. Brightly decorated, it has an enviable position on a corner where two canals meet and is perfect for watching the miriad of city residents cycle to work whilst you sip your coffee. You can walk to numerous local cafes and restaurants, Dam square is 5 minutes walk, Anne Frank's house about 10 and even Central Station is only 20 minutes. There are also nearby tram stops at Westermarkt and Elandsgracht. We found wandering around the canals and nine streets in the evening is a complete contrast to the busier streets around Dam square and other parts of Amsterdam and the hotel made a perfect base. We selected it after reading reviews here (and after reading less complimentary reviews of other hotels) and can only say we weren't disappointed and would probably go back

Reviews.Title: “I'm staying there again in 2011 when I return!”
Reviews.Author: Dovhoz
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to Amsterdam for the first time this past summer and chose this hotel based on reviews, price and location. All reviews noted this place worthy if not great, the price was VERY affordable and the location optimal as it was centered in the old city and convenient to all things local and touristy-whatever your tastes. The hotel offered a very friendly staff, old charm decor, and an onsite friendly German Shepherd if you find yourself missing your pets like I did. They also provided a tasty "serve yourself" complimentary breakfast in a quaint dining room overlooking a canal. The room I stayed in was a single with a twin bed and shower. It was very clean! Their only downside was they didn't have an elevator or lift and their stairs are very steep (remember you'll have luggage!) and I stayed on the 2nd floor of the 3? story building, but this is commonplace amongst hotels in the old city. There was no A/C, but they had a fan in the room and the night temperature even in mid July was quite comfortable. I also took advantage of their onsite bike rental. I had a great trip and am looking forward to visiting again next year and staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Amsterdam Hotel Experience in Years. We'll definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: derailment
Reviews.Content: The Wiechmann is a mid-sized, family-run hotel in a beautiful neighborhood, located at the cross of 2 canals, in inner-city Amsterdam. The hotel itself, about 30 rooms, is a series of 4 old houses stitched together over a period of about 60 years of continuous family ownership. This haphazard anastamose of buildings created a charming little hotel of steep stairways (no lift), short hallways and beautiful common rooms. It fronts the Prinzenstrasse canal, in the middle of several charming residential/commercial neighborhoods. It's just a block or two from the Jordaanplein and a few blocks from the Leidseplein. There are numerous small restaurants and esoteric little shops in all directions close by. It's very, very well located. We stayed in 2 different rooms, but I looked into several others. The rooms are small-ish, but they're well appointed with good beds, thick curtains, cute antiques and adequate heating. I think all the rooms are en suite. The baths are clean with modern new fixtures, plenty of hot water and awesome water pressure in the showers. Breakfast is served in a beautiful common room, surrounded by windows, overlooking the busy bicycle traffic at the 2 intersecting canals. Breakfast was a substantial buffet and the coffee was strong, smooth and excellent. As if you couldn't tell, I LOVED this place. I think it's the best 2 star (**) we've ever stayed in and we'll definitely be coming back. The staff is wonderful, english speaking, and they'll help you with your bags up those stairways.

Reviews.Title: “A remarkable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nopesar
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is true about the tiny and steep staircase. Get over it ! If you can't deal with it, go stay in a modern hotel with its elevator and dull and uniform rooms. The hotel is full of character and charm. The 'old' furniture is part of the charm, contrary to what the negative reviews say. The room we stayed in has all the modern amenities - flatscreen TV and wonderful shower, etc and it was very clean. We asked for a canal view room and we got one with even a balcony. It was a treat - feeling the pulse of Amsterdam at any time of the day (caution : if you are a light sleeper, it may be a bit too noisy for you). The location is superb - imagine everyday at breakfast, you look out to not only a canal view but also the comings and goings of everyday life in Amsterdam - priceless ! Like the other reviews mentioned, we walked everywhere - museums, ann frank house, the Dom, etc. To be honest, walking made us appreciate Amsterdam more vs watching things go by from a tram or bus. We will love to be back !

Reviews.Title: “Solid, if uninspiring, choice for Amsterdam hotel in the Canal Belt”
Reviews.Author: sosa1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed here five nights with my partner on our trip to Amsterdam. We generally liked the hotel, given our limited budget. The breakfast was included with the room and included continental fare -- peaches, toast, jams/jellies, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. The best thing about the hotel is its location, at least for those who prefer to walk rather than take taxis or ride trams. In a city that is somewhat difficult to navigate entirely on foot, the Wiechmann is well-placed, because it's only a 10-15 min. walk to the Dam Square, a 15-min. walk to Museumplein (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum), a 10-min. walk to the Anne Frank House, and a 15-min. walk to the Red Light District. We didn't end up taking the tram very often because we found it convenient and much more pleasant just to walk from place to place. The one disappointment we had about the hotel is that in requesting a room with a queen bed for two travelers, we ended up with two double beds pushed together (but not physically linked with the same sheets, bedding, etc.) We made do, but were disappointed that the hotel failed to honor our request for a single large bed, and when we asked to be moved, they were not able to accommodate our request.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Minty4
Reviews.Content: Booking hotels can be very hit and miss but we felt we struck gold with this hotel. Neither of us had high expectations, after all, we did get a special offer and so it was very reasonably priced which could have meant poor quality. Instead we found ourselves on a delightful corner of Prinsengracht. The outside of the hotel does little to give away the treasures to be found inside. This hotel is not for the unfit - you may find yourself on the fourth floor and to say the stairs are steep might be seen as an understatement. They are however, completely in character with the style of building and if you can't cope with steep stairs, you might miss a lot of Amsterdam. We were greeted in a friendly and welcoming manner and directed to our room on the first floor. Once we regained our breath after climbing the stairs with luggage in tow we were delighted. The room wasn't fancy but it was clean and functional and we were delighted to see we had a balcony (not all rooms have them). The beds were comfortable and we slept well every night. Breakfast was a continental affair on the ground floor corner of the hotel, looking out over what has apparently been described as the nicest corner in Amsterdam. We enjoyed watching Amsterdam life as we drank tea and fresh orange juice. (We never did manage to work out exactly who has right of way on the road and where - it appears to be a free for all but I was fascinated by the volume of the bicyles and how we didn't see any accidents (it's really mad, honestly!)) Just be careful in the buffet area of the breakfast room, it can get a bit cramped when more than a few people are serving themselves at the same time and I witnessed a few near accidents - particularly with the hot drinks. The hotel displays some interesting pieces of furniture which are family possessions and their pride and love of their business shines through. I can't think of a single thing to fault. The hotel is entirely non-smoking, the entrance is locked from about 4.00pm each day, each room has a safety deposit box and Taz (the family dog) adds to the sense of security I felt whilst staying at the Amsterdam Weichmann. Thank you Mr Boddy - you have an excellent family run hotel - please don't ever sell it to a chain! If I ever return to Amsterdam, I will not hesitate to book your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Again, shabby and old”
Reviews.Author: EddieKn
Reviews.Content: the only decent thing about the hotel is its location and view overlooking the canal. 1-the staff are ok but not that helpful 2-no elevator in the hotel so we had to carry our heavy bags over the stairs. 3-the room is so old fashioned but fairly big with a big window with a great view.4-the place is calm at night so we had a good sleep.5-the bathroom is fine but the ceiling is covered with disgusting green flies.6-a very poor breakfast buffet 7- the bellman and the guard of the hotel is simply a dog, a disgusting old , bad smelling dog 8-the hotel is so overpriced..

Reviews.Title: “Charming but shabby hotel in the best neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: PLily
Reviews.Content: I want to give this hotel a better score because it really was a charming old building, the staff were friendly & helpful & the area is the best area in Amsterdam (oh & the dog was cute & sweet). However, my room was old, stuffy, not very clean, & tiny. I was prepared for the size as I did select the "very small single" & I have stayed in equally tiny places before but if they are clean & fresh, it's not so bad. This room was grotty & it got really hot, I couldn't wait to get out of there in the morning. Lucky I had a fan in my room but I overheard another guest asking for a fan in his room, so they must not all come with fans. I would not have been able to sleep if I didn't have one. Another thing that bugged me was that on a few occasions the cleaner did not replace my toilet paper & threw out my soap! The hotel did not have a lift which I don't normally mind but the staircase was so narrow I struggled to get my suitcase up there. The breakfast was average. There was enough to fill you up but I had stayed at Hotel 26 in Berlin prior to staying here & their breakfast was amazing so perhaps I was a little spoilt. The internet connection was very temperamental. I had to bring my laptop down into the communal lounge (which was a nice place to hang out) but even then it didn't always work. They did have a computer which you could use if you didn't have a laptop. Despite all this, I did enjoy my stay as the Jordaan really is the most charming neighbourhood in Amsterdam. My friends stayed at a slightly cheaper (though slightly less charming) hotel in the Red Light District & I did not envy them. I would only ever stay in the Jordaan but if I were to stay at Hotel Wiechmann again I would definitely pay a bit extra for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Wiechmann”
Reviews.Author: Maggie66Boston
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam with our 2 children ages 7 and 9. We stayed in the "family room" on the first floor (I believe room 120). The "family room" is basically 2 rooms connected with a sliding door. First of all these rooms were HUGE. They had heavy mouldings and high cielings. The bathroom was also quite large. The beds were comfortable. One room has beautiful bay windows looking out to the canal. And the other room has windows looking into an inner courtyard. I would say the rooms have "character". Sure there was a bit of peeling paint and cracks but it adds to the experience! The lobby was quite pleasant. My children loved the dog. The breakfast was great -- the breakfast room was beautiful with huge windows looking over 2 canals. We were looking for more of an "authentic" lodging experience and the canal house hotel hit the money! We felt like we were taken back to another time. The location is fabulous! Very close to everything but particularly close to the Anne Franke house. Their front desk staff has 24 hour shifts so there was a different person at the desk every day. All were quite helpful and friendly. We particularly liked "Nata" (?sp) who was quite kind to us during our bleary-eyed, jet-lagged registration. We absolutely loved Amsterdam. Despite its reputation its actually quite a fun place for families. We would highly recommend the italian restaurante La Festa right near the hotel. Delicious Italian which is good for families!

Reviews.Title: “MUST be the best location in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: nkwroger
Reviews.Content: After a full day of flying, we arrived at the Wiechmann in the early evening and pretty tired. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful, suggesting a great seafood restaurant. We promptly got checked in, freshened up and headed out to dinner. What a great introduction to the city. Our walk to dinner took us over the Western canals and into the lower part of downtown which was lively and charming. The Anne Frank Huis was right up the street, and it is an amazing museum and tribute to the Frank family. We were able to walk or take the very convenient streetcars anywhere from our hotel. There is even a little Stop 'n' Go bus that speeds up and down Prinsengracht all day if you really don't feel like walking. But the neighborhood is so darling you would be doing yourself a disservice by not exploring it by foot. The breakfast at the Wiechmann is very complete and fresh, and the staff always made our stay very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Simple & comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: robpiotrowski
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Hotel Wiechmann to anyone travelling to Amsterdam. Our room was cozy and clean, and had everything we needed. The breakfast was amazing. The location was beautiful, absolutely stunning :) They also have a very friendly doggy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: ltlwing64
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location within walking distance to everything! View from the breakfast room absolutely charming. Staff friendly enough, but no help is offered trying to carry luggage up several flights of VERY STEEP stairs. Perhaps I needed to ask for help, but as I have never had to in any establishment elsewhere, I just got on with it. Lots of wonderful shops and restaurants nearby - felt very safe even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Wiechmann IS Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RHBSFB
Reviews.Content: A frequent visitor to Trip Advisor, I have never taken the time to write a review. Though our visit to the Wiechmann was in '09, it was our 3rd time at the property over the years, so we know it pretty well. The Wiechmann is in a quiet neighborhood overlooking a canal, a perfect spot to soak up the astmosphere of life in Amsterdam. The location is the best of both worlds. In the immediate neighborhood are select restaurants and pubs and shops. Within 10 minutes walk is all the action of Dam Square. John Boddy is the Innkeeper, completes the experience. He is a great host, and always has wonderful advice and local knowledge to share. My wife and I have had the opportunity to travel the world for the last 25 years and agree that The Hotel Wiechmann is one of the more memorable places we have had the pleasure of staying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location! Fabulous Canal Views!”
Reviews.Author: Zidore
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Wiechmann for many years now. The people are lovely and very warm. The neighborhood is quintessentially Amsterdam but not noisy or overbearing as others, closer to the centre, are. The capacious breakfast dining room has to be my favorite of all hotel dining rooms, located on a corner with a canal view. Breakfast is always fun while watching an unbelievable number of bicyclists of all ages zipping to school or work. Rooms are bright and cheerful and cozy. I wouldn't stay anywhere else and I've been to lots of A'dam mom-and-pop hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rothaiocht
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Wiechmann where we were made feel very welcome from the minute we entered the hotel. The staff on reception always had lots of smiles for us. The hotel is very cosy, you can set the heating in your bedroom. The rooms are spotless. We had a canal view room which was lovely to wake up to in the morning. Nice to see the mad cyclists in the snow. Nothing seems to stop an Amsterdam cyclist. The location is just brilliant, everywhere you might want to go was within walking distance. It was also a lovely area to wander around, the canal is lovely. The breakfast room has lovely views of the canal and the breakfast is more than adequate, cereals, fruit, cheese, toast and juices. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in a perfect location in lovely Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Room Full of Spiders”
Reviews.Author: Vandler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, but the rooms are tired and small, some of the furniture is broken and, worst of all, there are many spiders. Apparently, the maid does not do her job properly. This two-star hotel is also way overpriced. The rate for the double room was 165 euros per night even though, as it turned out, three- and four-star hotels in the area charged 110-150 euros per night. Even Krasnapolsky had excellent standard rooms with a double bed for 129 euros. Why pay 165 euros for an inferior room at Wiechmann?

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thump29
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the Wiechmann! The first day that we arrived in Amsterdam we were confronted with a dental emergency. We were staying in a nearby houseboat and simply walked into the Wiechmann early in the morning and asked the grey haired English (?) gentleman at the desk if he could give us advice. He immediately went on line, made a number of phone calls and we had an appointment early that afternoon! He gave us a map that showed our location as well as that of the dentist. He was a life saver to us. All that for a couple of people off the streets. THANKS

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in canal area of center city.”
Reviews.Author: maringfro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced (for Amsterdam) and is in a charming old house with no elevator. The staff will help take luggage up and down stairs however. The location is great since it is on a canal and the "stop and go" vehicle drives right by the hotel and will stop for you along its route further into the city. It's also within walking distance of many must-see sites for those with good walking legs like the Anne Frank Museum, Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, etc. A substantial breakfast is served and is included in the price of the room. Two computers are available for guests to use at no cost. A friendly dog awaits you in the reception area. The room was adequate. By not facing the canal, it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Steep Stairs - No Elevators - Stay on Lowest Floor Possible”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMolo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday coming from a two week river cruise. (Budapest to Amsterdam on the AMA Cruise - Ship was the Amadaggio...Wonderful, Fantastic Trip). We had some bulky and heavy luggage and made a huge mistake by not reserving a lower level room as the hotel does not have an elevator and the stairs are VERY STEEP AND NARROW. As this was a Sunday, the only staff was a young lady who with my help pushed and pulled, with grunts and groans, up the many stairs to our room. If you're young and traveling light and don't mind the climb, fine....go for the eagle's nest. If you're like me, older, retired, and out of shape make sure your reservation keeps you as close to the main floor as possible. Other than this, the hotel was o.k. Not great, but a decent value and a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Simple yet Charming, and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shoyley
Reviews.Content: We reserved and received a canal view room (126) for five nights. The room is very big by European standards. It is simply furnished and very clean. Two twin beds were pushed together to make up the bed, and the mattresses sagged a little - wasn't an issue though. The room has three large windows facing Prisengracht canal, which is a major canal, and there is so much to look at day and night - bikes, boats, shops, people, gables.... Amsterdam is a city full of movements; canal view definitely is worth the extra money. Breakfast is adequate with hard boiled eggs, cheeses, lunch meats, bread, toasts, spreads, juices, cereals, hot chocolate, different kinds of tea, & coffee. The breakfast room has large windows facing the canal and is bright and airy, decorated with family antiques; spending 30mins there in the morning is a great way to start the day. There are two computers with internet for guests to use without charge in a quiet computer room. This is a very kind touch considering many hotels in the city charge for internet. There is also a comfy sitting room furnished with large windows, antiques, and a large screen TV in the hotel for guests to use. The location of the hotel is great. We were able to get to all the places (Central Station, Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, Dam Sq., Chinatown, Portuguese Synagogue, Nemo, the flea markets, all the pleins, etc.) on foot and never used the tram or bus; again, there is so much to look at and explore in the city, so walking (if you can) is the best and be prepared to be sidetracked. Hotel staff is very helpful in pointing out directions. The whole feel to the hotel is charming (old-fashioned yet bright and airy), clean, and well taken care of. Coming back from exploring and from the Amsterdam night life, the hotel ties you back to that steadiness and quiet dignity of the old-world. We will definitely stay there again when we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amazing view from our room”
Reviews.Author: nlchica
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Weichmann and loved everything about it, from the helpful staff, the free computers, the substantial breakfast and the friendly housekeeping folks to the nice dog in the lobby. It consists of 3 row houses and we were in room 239 in the house on the corner. The extra euros for the canal view are worth every penny. We could throw open both sets of french doors and have an amazing view of the intersecting canals, bicycle riders and neighbors. Our room was spacious and clean and very comfortable. We were up two flights of steep stairs but the staff carried our luggage up for us. The location is awesome. The "Stop & Go" bus stops right in front and goes along the Prisengracht canal in both directions. An Albert Hein grocery store is right around the corner (cash only/ATM outside) and further down Elandstraat (if you can believe it) a great organic burger place called Burger Meester (try the one with eggplant, zuchinni and onion on a great juicy burger with cheese!). Toward town on Ruunstraat at #7 is the most amazing cheese store and a bread store near that, so lunches were easy. Across the canal and west a few blocks the Van Puffelin (spelling?) was a very nice and reasonable place for dinner. I would definitely go back to the Weichmann and enjoyed being away from the center city but only a short walk away. Can't say enough good things about our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Home.”
Reviews.Author: elmbeetle
Reviews.Content: Comfortable clean Hotel in good central location. Had a home like ambiance. Small room and bathroom with window over the Canal and great views. Not too noisy at night time. Internet good. Host and desk staff very helpful with good English. Substanital serve your self breakfast in breafast room with lovely views of people riding their bikes to work along the canals. Food outlets and resteraunts nearby varible in quality and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “charming but average service”
Reviews.Author: Travelman245b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there last weekend for one night with a friend of mine, the lobby is nice, but the room we had was nothing special fÃ¼r 150 EUR per night, clean but soulless and a very tiny bathroom, for a 2 Star Hotel quite to expensive. the hotel is central and this is the most important advantage. Unfortunately, the people who worked at the frontdesk seems to be poorly skilled and motivated students. I am not sure, but the servicelevel was an such a poor level. One funny experiences I made: The keys are only for the room, and we found the hotel closed on saturday at 8.p.m. With a little note, thats nobody there, because it is necessary to walk the dog. We were not able to enter the hotel. So we waited for 25 minutes. The girl came back with the dog and probably her boyfriend, extremly relaxed, no excuse, no feeling sorrow just mentioning: "She was only out for 10 Minutes". I took it with humor, but i have never seen anything like that. The management should think about servicestandard. I would not recommend this hotel for a longer stay, for one night it was okay. breakfast was okay, charming breakfastroom. Result: Small and charming, overpriced and poor services

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: vt1
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Wiechmann Hotel is in a great central location in Amsterdam. The room was very spacious as was the ensuite bath. We had a canal view room and the room furnishings were nice, the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was included with the room rate, which consisted of mostly breads, cheese, meat, coffee, and juice. It was not a big breakfast but plenty to eat and the breakfast room was very comfortable and spacious. There were two computers for guests to use. They were available 24/7 at no additional charge. The only major drawback was the lack of AC, which might not normally be a problem but the weather was unseasonably warm while we were there. Some nights it was too noisy on the streets to open the windows and get a decent night's sleep. Overall, we really liked the hotel, the Staff was extremely helpful and courteous, and we would definitely stay there again;

Reviews.Title: “An OK Amsterdam experience”
Reviews.Author: danfortuna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wiechmann one weekend night in March. I was looking for a good and inexpensive experience (I've been splurging too much lately) and picked the Weichmann over more upscale properties because of the price. Overall it was not bad and not great. The pluses: the hotel staff was uniformly helpful, cheerful, and polite. The big lobby dog was a treat to play with. The room was clean and had a small keyed safe. The bed was comfy. Breakfast was OK with lots of good coffee. Oh -- and the location was good. Not right on the middle of everything, but a quick walk to the Dam and shopping areas, and very close to a nice coffeehouse and couple of bars. The drawbacks: the room (and I had the cheapest single) was incredibly small -- the room was barely wide enough for the bed. I had no view. There were free computers with internet access near the lobby, but the network login password wasn't working so I could not use it until the next morning. I didn't mind the steep and winding stairs, but then I only had a backpack. So very middle-of-the-road. A good choice if you're watching your Euros - especially if you can get a canal view room.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: clapton1
Reviews.Content: The Wiechmann is in a great location, on the Prinsengracht, walking distance to everything. We had a room on the 3rd floor and getting our substantial luggage up there was a dreadful experience. The stairs are steep and twisted and not contiguous so you're switching from one staircase to another mid-trip. We were later told that normally someone would have carried our bags, but there was only one new person on desk duty that evening. They did find someone to bring our bags down when we checked out. We were there for three days and enjoyed the hotel and the location. We had the only room with a balcony and, although it was cold and rainy during our stay, this was a feature we enjoyed. Otherwise, the room wasn't memorable; in fact, there was mold on the bathroom ceiling. But everything worked well and we were happy there. We took advantage of the free computer use on the main floor every day of our stay. Breakfast is included in the price and there were boiled eggs and equipment to toast your bread. Other than that, it was the standard breakfast served in these kinds of places....lousy lunch meat, lousy cheese, a basket of winter fruit., cheap bread, canned peaches and, of course, abundant coffee and tea. We encountered great variation in the helpfulness of the staff. When we asked for additional pillows the first night, we were asked to come down and get them! We told the guy that he was younger than us and should bring them up! And there were a couple of women at the front desk who knew nothing about the surrounding neighborhood...even telling us to go as far as the Leidseplein to find a public telephone when we later found one around the corner! There's no excuse for untrained, uneducated front-desk staff at a hotel that charges 140E/night. On our last day, the owner of the hotel, helped us locate a hotel in Brussels for our last night, and we were very appreciative of his assistance. He did, however, charge us for the phone calls he made to Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs up, A Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: seatosea
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Amsterdam for the first time, and what a wonderful place it is! It is just as cool as I have always heard it is, only cooler! Just a beautiful city, sort of like a large Greenwich village, with canals, boats, and bikes running all through it. Cobblestone strreets with great little bars, cafes and "coffee shops" ;-) around every corner. My partner and I walked for hours, day & night. The whole city seems so sureal. The streets are quiet, with very few cars, tons of bikes, and 15th & 16th century buildings lining canal after canal. We both felt very relaxed and really enjoyed the whole experience. The Wiechmann Hotel is a great place to stay. It is not a luxury hotel, nor is it trying to be. If that is what you are looking for you may be disappointed...and you will pay more. It is a fairly simple, typical European style, small Hotel. It is well run, clean, and charming in its own way...with a few extras that make it special. First, all the rooms are non-smoking, and so is the breakfast room. This was my main reason for choosing this hotel, as I am easily bothered by the smell of smoke. Smoking is only permitted in the lobby/lounge area, while we were there this was not a problem. I assume most of the guests are non-smokers as well. I so appreciate the few non-smoking places in Amsterdam, this is one of them. (By the way, there actually are a few restaurants that are starting to offer smoke free rooms or areas, and it is indicated on the window with a decal. Of course there are also all the wonderful outdoor cafes, where the smoking is less bothersome) Next, the location of the hotel is perfect, as so many other reviewers have said. It sits right across the road from one of the central canals with wonderful views from the lobby and breakfast room of passerby's on foot and bicycle. From this spot you can walk to just about everywhere, in any direction. If you head straight out the door and across the bridge just in front of the hotel it takes you directly into the heart of town by way of plenty shops, bars and cafes. If you walk to the left, you will come to The Joordan area with more quaint shops, bars and cafes. If you walk to the right, it is a few blocks to Leidstraat, a main central road, and Leidsplein, a cool commercial square with banks, bars, restaurants, stores, tourist info and canal boat tours. From here you can catch one of the easy to use trams which connect the whole city, and to the central train station. The trams are great when you get tired of walking. The hotel, which comprises three canal house buildings in a row, is architecturally beautiful on the outside. At night it is lit-up and looks really nice from across the canal. Our room in the back, on the third floor was basic and simple: Two single beds pushed together with comfortable enough mattresses; a table, two chairs, desk area, a key-safe, and an armoire to unpack into; a decent size bathroom and shower with soap and shampoo; and two large windows that opened to let in the fresh air. It was very neat and clean, with maid service everyday. And yes, the stairs! They are steep and narrow and tiring, and like most similar hotels, there is no elevator. The breakfast was also simple but enjoyable. Nothing to write home about but it was free! Good coffee, toast, jams, cereal, boiled eggs, ham, cheese and a little fresh fruit. The view from the room, as described, is very storybook! I found the staff to be efficient and cordial, as I found the Amsterdamers in general. I would not describe the Dutch as gregarious people, but always polite and courteous, in a mind-your-own-business sort of way, which suits me just fine. As a point of reference, I own a restaurant, so I know what it takes to run a business and to try to please people. No matter how hard you try there will always be some who are not satisfied. I read a few of the negative comments below, but I also read between the lines, and I am glad I did. I cannot say I have any complaints about this hotel. I am obviously recommending it to those seeking a well run, perfectly adequate, and relatively inexpensive, place to stay. As I said it is not a luxury resort, but it is a really cool place to stay in a really cool city. When I return to Amsterdam, I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the Wiechmann Hotel much.”
Reviews.Author: CameraTotinMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel, in June 2007. The physical facility is decent (as long as you're healthy enough, and have moderately sized suitcases, so that the steep narrow staircases won't give you trouble.) But the service orientation is really lacking. I paid 100 euros for my room, and neither the TV nor the wireless internet was working, not exactly what I expect for that price. When I went to check out, I asked the girl at the desk if these deficiencies might merit some price reduction, she said no but she'd call the owner to see what he said. His response was a big laugh. I told her OK but pointed out that in this day and age with people posting reviews of their hotel experiences on the internet, I would feel obligated to inform people of both positive and negative aspects of my stay. I was being polite the whole time, as I was certainly not in a position to demand a reduced price (the hotel was in no way obligated), I just wanted to see if they'd want to give one to show that they recognized the deficiences as not normal. Nonetheless her immediate response was to say in an offended way, "That sounds like a threat!" So if you'd like to stay at a place where tripadvisor reviews are seen as a threat, then the Wiechmann Hotel is the place for you ;-). Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing canal views at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Bunnny
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 3 nights of our honeymoon at the Hotel Wiechmann in May 2007. We booked through the hotel's website, which is easy to use and you know exactly what type of room you are booking, which is rarely the case in my experience of booking hotel rooms. I was desperate for a canal view, having stayed in Amsterdam three times previously in a succession of rooms with appalling views (at both the Pulitzer and Krasnapolsky we overlooked internal corridors/roofs and at the Swissotel, unbelievably, the window was only feet away from the wall of the next building and allowed very little daylight into the room.) Most hotels offering rooms with canal views charge exorbitant rates for these rooms. We booked a double room at the Wiechmann with bath, shower and canal view, with breakfast included, for 150 Euros per night, which compared very favourably with rates I had been offered elsewhere. We took a taxi from the Dorint Sofitel Amsterdam Airport (an excellent hotel - see my review elsewhere), which cost 35 Euros. You could not ask for a more central hotel than the Hotel Wiechmann. Amsterdam is right on your doorstep, with Dam Square and Leidseplein both within walking distance. Be prepared, though, that the hotel decor is very old fashioned and may not be to everyone's taste - as another reviewer wrote, it is a little like staying at your grandparents' house. Our room wasn't huge; large enough for a double bed, wardrobe, dressing table, a small table and an armchair. There was no mini bar but there was a small wall safe. However, even if I wasn't bowled over by the decor and facilities, I certainly got my canal view! Wow! We had a corner room and the whole of the outside wall on two sides of the room consisted of floor to ceiling windows, two of which opened onto a ledge with a pretty wrought iron grill to elbow height, almost like having a balcony. And the canal is right outside. The only drawback with the central location and canal view is that it is very noisy at night - we were there over a weekend, though; perhaps it isn't as bad during the week. We were on the first floor (i.e. one floor up from the street) and, while trying to get to sleep, I could overhear people asking for directions in the street below. The first time we went down to breakfast we were extremely disappointed. It was a Saturday morning and very busy. The tables are packed in tight and there was barely space to pull out a chair to sit down. Breakfast is essentially an unsupervised buffet, with a pretty limited selection. We didn't bother with breakfast on the Sunday morning, but decided we should on the Monday morning as we were flying home that evening and had a long day ahead of us. It was a completely different experience. The breakfast room was almost desserted and we were able to sit at a table in the window with views out onto the street and canals. It was lovely. Be warned that, although the rooms are non-smoking, the public areas are not, and you have to pass through these to reach the rooms. Smoke also tends to drift up the stairs towards the rooms, which is very unpleasant. The stairs might cause problems for some, as they are very steep and narrow and you have to carry your own luggage. The staff were civil but not exactly chatty.
