On a more positive note, there is a small computer room behind reception with unlimited free internet access, which we really appreciated. A previous hotel had charged 5 Euros for 30 minutes. If you are looking for a bed and breakfast (because that is what this is, really) in central Amsterdam with enviable canal views, I would definitely recommend Hotel Wiechmann.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted from our trip.”
Reviews.Author: familytrio
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Wiechmann. When the Opstopper picked us up at the Station, someone mentioned a day budget hotel and my heart plummeted. However when we arrived I knew it was exactly what we wanted. A small family style hotel, full of character and ambience. Yes the rooms are basic but very clean and all you need except a hairdryer, which they probably could have provided but I never asked. The situation is perfect, near everything. We got to see so much in the 3 days and all on foot. The staff were really nice and helpful, before we arrived and during out stay, even recommended a lovely restaurant. The breakfast room was a threat. We loved watching the world go by over a leisurely breakfast. In our opinion it is a great 2 star typical canal house ..hotel ...with the traditional steep stairs. The price may be considered high, but it is on Princengracht ., the best area in amsterdam,so central, you save a lot on transport costs. We hope to re-visit Amsterdam again and will stay definitely in the Wiechmann. The Walsh Family Co. Tipperary Ireland

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a canal view”
Reviews.Author: WDF
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in June. Excellently situated and clean. The suites are an excellent choice and compete well in price. Staff very helpful. Only negative was the limited choice for breakfast but with many cafes nearby this is not a problem

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, not so keen on the stairs”
Reviews.Author: wightrose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for our second wedding anniversary. We stayed in room 240 which had two big double windows and a set of double doors opening out onto a balcony (well more of a ledge really) but the view was quite spectacular. The stairs are incredibly steep and quite hard to negotiate with luggage, but it is worth it for the view from the room. The bathroom was clean and tidy with bath and shower, although some of the furniture in the room could do with being replaced. The hotel facilities are fairly limited, but with the central location it didn't really matter anyway. Breakfast is served until 10am and there's a pretty good selection. Would stay here again, but only in room 239 or 240

Reviews.Title: “More of a B&B”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with my boyfriend. We were in room 239, ask for it, it was the ONLY saving grace. This is not a real hotel, more like a Bed and Breakfast. It's like staying at your grandparents house, but grandparents that are cash strapped and haven't redecorated in 30 years. Everything is shabby and there is no real hotel service at all. You have your own key to the front door, and there are no typical hotel amenities. But the location can't be beat. It's lovely. Room 239 is large with huge bay windows and a great view of the canal. Though the walls are cracking and everything is old, the bathroom was newish and clean. I imagine there is better value for money to be found in Amsterdam, but we loved the view and the size of our canal facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience...”
Reviews.Author: mmgiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our four days at Hotel Weichmann...this was our first trip to Amsterdam and we found the hotel in a perfect location, not touristy, yet close to everything. The rooms are small and plain, but the staff was always helpful and the breakfast room bright and cheery with a good, basic choice of items. The free use of computers with internet was a nice bonus. Ask for room 307 (125 euro per night), as we seemed to luck out for our honeymoon and had one of the only rooms with a balcony overlooking the canal. No doubt there are fancier hotels or maybe even better deals, but this was a lovely choice and we definitely would return to Hotel Wiechmann.

Reviews.Title: “appalling value for money”
Reviews.Author: gerry17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its great reviews we found it appalling value for money. This is not a hotel but an overpriced B+B we paid 135 euros per night. The rooms are tired and grubby we had no view, no iron and no kettle. Look eleswhere for a better deal you can do so much better.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Noslo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wiechann was a great choice for us (couple in our mid-30s). The hotel has lots of character and is perfectly situated. Our 4th-floor room was huge for European standards and we had a spectacular view. We really looked forward to people watching late at night from our room. While there was some slight noise on a few nights from the street/canal (which didnâ€™t bother my husband at all and was easily remedied with earplugs for me), we were pleasantly surprised by how little we could hear from the rooms surrounding ours. The young staff was friendly and helpful when we asked questions. The breakfast room was very quaint; the breakfast was standard (eggs, meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurt), yet satisfying. I very-much appreciated that the rooms were non-smoking and did not smell smoke in the lounge area (despite being sensitive to the smell). Yes, the steps are steep (but add to the hotelâ€™s character) and a few (very few) of the furnishings â€œdingy.â€� But these, for us, were so irrelevant given the size of and view from our room and the great character and location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: IrelandJill
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that so many people rate the Wiechmann Hotel highly. I found the staff cold and unfriendly. Our 4th floor room was not heated and when we asked for extra blankets we had to carry them upstairs ourselves. There was no hairdryer, kettle or trouser press as you would expect for 125 euro per night. The breakfast was very basic. When we checked out after 4 nights we were not even asked if we enjoyed our stay. Not even a smile. It is a great pity as the hotel is in a teriffic location and could be wonderful. In contrast to this we found the people of Amsterdam generally extremely kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 wonderful days in Amsterdam at the Wiechamann. While there are many more luxurious and modern hotels in the city, its location and price make up for it. Our 3rd floor room had a commanding canal view. We particularly enjoyed having their sumptuous buffet breakfast in their corner dining room overlooking 2 canals and watching the boats, bikes, cars and predestrians go by. While not right in the city centre, it was within walking distance of most attractions, many fine restaurants and shops. The only drawback was not having an elevator which could be a problem for elderly or physically challenged people. The stairs are very steep but the friendly staff did help carry up our luggage. We managed just fine. We can highly recommend this facility and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to you find this fabu jewel and I won't have a room.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Glorious history aside, the commanding view of the Prinsengracht is worth the climb to your comfortable lodgings. You can lie back and watch the boats flow past your window, the bikers coming across the bridges with their own special brand of singing spokes, the church bells tolling for all of us to see and hear, the Flower Market which brazenly beckons us to join them in a cachophony of blooms and sweet perfume before you cross the street to frantic lifel Great restaurants, great transportation, flowers to DIE for, and clubs to meet new friends to share the experience of Olde England with cool new citizenry. Freedom and great social services keep the stress level low and the kindness up. I go each year and see John and the crew who so graciously and wonderfully care for us. The views are FABU! The breakfast room is worth the price of the stay-Close to all but staying in has its bonuses as well. Friendly and helpful, the staff has great ideas and suggestions but will merely service the hotel if you so choose. This is a family owned business and the 15th buildings are terribly romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid 140 euros a night for a grubby room that hadn't been decorated since the 60's. The bed was small and unconfortable. The shower was very basic (i.e. stand in a bath - that didn't work). The breakfast was also very average. The only plus side was the staff were quite friendly. My advice would be that a far better Hotel can found for the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NeilQ
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in Amsterdam at the Wiechmann. The location is excellent, a short walk to the museums, a little longer short walk to the city center. The room was very clean and well equipped. The staff is extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “location was superb, people were very helpful and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam-first time. Grrrrreat city. Found this hotel on search of the internet and supportive info from Frommer's and Conscierge. The location on Prinsengracht (Prince's Canal) was wonderful, especially since we opted for a canal facing room, which worked out spectacularly. The whole city was an easy walk or occasionally a close tram ride away.We could enjoy the experience of being on a city street, but not just Downtown, seeing bicycles and strolling and working people by the hundreds go by our place every day, even during the short times we were at the hotel. Bye the bye, we're in our 60's with average mobility and found this worked well for us.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Wiechmann
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 328-332, Amsterdam 1016 HX, The Netherlands
